Sentencas: A limiting factor for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) performance is the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) that occurs at the cathode surface.
Titulo: Surface Segregation in Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Thin Films and Its Potential Effect on the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: This study examines changes in the surface composition of (La0.8Sr0.2)(0.95)MnO3 (LSM-20), a well-known SOFC cathode material.
Titulo: Surface Segregation in Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Thin Films and Its Potential Effect on the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Heteroepitaxial thin films of LSM-20 were grown on lattice matched single crystal LaAlO3 and NdGaO3 substrates.
Titulo: Surface Segregation in Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Thin Films and Its Potential Effect on the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: Total Reflection X-ray Fluorescence (TXRF) measurements showed surface manganese enrichment on annealing at 800 degrees C in air.
Titulo: Surface Segregation in Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Thin Films and Its Potential Effect on the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: X-ray absorption near edge spectroscopy (XANES) showed that this leads to a redistribution of manganese 3+, 4+, and 2+ valence states at the surface.
Titulo: Surface Segregation in Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Thin Films and Its Potential Effect on the Oxygen Reduction Reaction

Sentencas: This was confirmed by defect modeling, which showed that surface Mn segregation leads to an increase in the surface concentration of oxygen vacancies and the Mn+4 species, both of which are expected to be beneficial for ORR.
Titulo: Surface Segregation in Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Thin Films and Its Potential Effect on the Oxygen Reduction Reaction
